image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: The ABC understands a man charged over an alleged serious assault in Melbourne's inner west over the weekend was released from immigration detention following a 2023 High Court ruling.

title.children: Released immigration detainee charged over serious Melbourne assault

image.altText: A villa in Bali where three motobikes are parked outside and the entrance is cornered off with police tap

props.synopsis: Zivan Radmanovic was killed on Saturday when two men broke into the villa he was staying in near the Bali tourist hotspot Canggu.

title.children: Bali police retract statement over arrest in Australian man's death in Bali villa shooting

image.altText: Australian writerÂ Alistair Kitchen stands holding a laptop he says he was denied entry to the United States

props.synopsis: Melbourne writer Alistair Kitchen was detained for 12 hours at Los Angeles International Airport, had his phone seized and was "interrogated" about his views on the conflict in the Middle East.

title.children: Australian denied entry to US after being grilled on Israel-Gaza views

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors tell Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial jury the mother of two carried out a "sinister deception" on her in-laws by using a "nourishing meal" as the vehicle for lethal doses of death-cap mushrooms.

title.children: 'Sinister deception' turned lunch into murder, prosecutor tells jury

image.altText: A woman with short hair and a blue shirt looks ahead.

props.synopsis: With more than 100,000 treatment cycles taking place yearly in Australia's growing IVF industry, those with first-hand experience say it's time for changes to increase transparency and simplify regulations.

title.children: IVF mix-ups raise questions about the rapidly growing industry

image.altText: An orange and white bus with "CDC Melbourne" written on the front parked at a depot under a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Some Victorian commuters will this morning find themselves stranded for the second time in a matter of weeks as bus drivers strike.Â

title.children: Hundreds of bus drivers walk off job in Victoria

image.altText: Bottle of spirits of vodka and whisky are lined a long a shelf.

props.synopsis: Victorian councils want to retain their power of veto over new liquor outlets in country towns amid fierce debate about the links between family violence and access to alcohol.

title.children: Ninth bottle shop proposed for Swan Hill as councils lose veto power

image.altText: A dark grey helicopter with the Victoria Police badge and word 'police' printed on the side hovers over blurred houses.

props.synopsis: A motorcyclist's bike, gloves and helmet were found near the site of a car and motorbike collision on the Hume Freeway near Wangaratta on Friday, and police are appealing for the rider or any witnesses to come forward.

title.children: Bike and clothing found but motorcyclist missing from Wangaratta crash site

image.altText: A white woman with short grey hair takes a selfie while hugging an Aboriginal woman in a pink dress with dark hair.

props.synopsis: Dr Margaret Niemann has been honoured for providing groundbreaking antenatal and mental healthcare in regional communities.

title.children: Trailblazing GP brought mental healthcare to communities that had none

image.altText: Energy tower with blue skies and fencing

props.synopsis: Australians struggling to pay their energy bills face 'major inconsistencies' in how retailers respond, a survey of financial counsellors has found. The energy sector is lagging behind banking and water when it comes to supporting customers in hardship.

title.children: The worst-ranked energy retailers when it comes to hardship provisions

image.altText: A home security camera affixed to a grey rendered wall

props.synopsis: With crime rates a big concern for many Australians, households are increasingly turning to technology to try to protect against thieves.

title.children: Do home security cameras deter thieves?

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Amid repeated prosecution accusations of murder, deceit and cover-up, there were exchanges about the right time for a "lie down" and errors in the days of the week, as Erin Patterson finished her evidence.

title.children: The moments from Erin Patterson's evidence that didn't make headlines

image.altText: Gloved hand holding a flask of golden liquid fuel inside a lab facility.

props.synopsis: It's tricky to decarbonise airplanes, but a plan to manufacture aviation fuel from canola looks set to take off.

title.children: Fuel giant's plan could use Australian canola for aviation fuel

image.altText: An aerial picture of Point Cook's skyline, with rows and rows of homes and Melbourne's CBD in the background

props.synopsis: A council in one of Melbourne's growing outer corridors is facing criticism for diverting funding away from a region where locals are calling for more basic infrastructure.

title.children: Backlash after Melbourne council redirects funding from growing suburb

image.altText: Man standing in Bali shop with drinks in the background.

props.synopsis: The community of a small Balinese village is reeling after a brutal attack on Saturday killed one Melbourne man and seriously injured another.

title.children: Bali community reels after fatal villa shooting

image.altText: Rana Dadpour looks seriously at the camera.

props.synopsis: Iranian Australians opposed to the country's authoritarian regime say they feel "mixed" emotions of anxiety for their loved ones, and relief high-level regime officials have been killed, after Israel launched an attack on the country last week.

title.children: Iranian Australians share 'mixed' feelings after Israeli strikes

image.altText: Nick Carver and Peter Foley

props.synopsis: This little pub is growing a big reputation as a popular live music venue in regional Victoria. Facing financial breaking point, it survived by calling out for community subscribers, who pay an annual membership fee.

title.children: Country pub is a 'chameleon venue' championing live music and the arts

image.altText: Carlton AFL player Harry McKay stands on the ground wearing a team jacket, holding a football.

props.synopsis: Harry McKay's knee injury isn't healing as first hoped, with Carlton to decide this week whether their star forward requires surgery, as West Coast co-captain Oscar Allen avoids serious injury in the loss to the Blues.

title.children: Blues weighing up surgery for McKay, Eagles 'hopeful' Allen avoids serious injury

image.altText: A landscape showing steep rock formations rising up out of hilly bushland.

props.synopsis: When Hyun Park slipped while climbing in the Warrumbungles, her life depended on her 80-year-old mentor and the tactical gymnastics of a 20-hour overnight rescue mission.

title.children: Remarkable 20-hour rescue of Melbourne climber dangling unconscious 200m up a cliff

image.altText: A couple standing on the side of a road in amongst snow-covered mountains

props.synopsis: Alpine region businesses are calling for the ability to offer work to non-UK tourists who need employment to extend their visas under the Working Holiday Maker scheme.

title.children: Calls to include alpine resorts in working holiday visa scheme

image.altText: Photo of All Are Welcome bakery window with a building reflected in the glass.

props.synopsis: The ABC reported in recent days staff at the three inner-Melbourne All Are Welcome bakeries were owed $243,000 in superannuation and $125,000 in leave entitlements.

title.children: Popular bakeries close their doors with staff owed super, leave

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: A survivor of institutional child sex abuse has won a "landmark" claim for negligence against one of Australia's most prominent law firms.

title.children: Abuse survivor wins 'landmark' case against high-profile law firm

image.altText: An elderly man holding up a piece of jewellery and a small eye-piece smiling at the camera. In the background in his workshop

props.synopsis: Scores of small and medium businesses are closing across Victoria as online shops boom outside the legal commitments of bricks-and-mortar retailers.Â

title.children: Surging $69b online shopping market puts small family business legacies at risk

image.altText: Dark-haired Woman in a black and white stripped footy guernsey ready to kick the ball while on the field.

props.synopsis: A number of players in a Victorian women's league are calling for a male player to be suspended over allegations of sexual assault.

title.children: Female footballers boycott major game over alleged sexual assault

image.altText: Three chickens on the grass.

props.synopsis: Agriculture Victoria has declared four properties in Euroa free from avian influenza after disease eradication activities.

title.children: Restrictions lifted as latest bird flu outbreak in Victoria eradicated

image.altText: Red tomatoes on the vine

props.synopsis: An Australian tomato processor is selling its seed and skin by-products to beauty brands making moisturisers, facial scrubs and sunscreen as the industry is squeezed by cheap imports.

title.children: Tomato processor turns seeds and skin into ingredients for cosmetics

image.altText: Preston and Heidelberg players on the pitch in front of a huge team flag that says Preston Makedonia F.C

props.synopsis: An investigation involving a Melbourne soccer club, Victoria Police and Football Victoria is underway after multiple spectators reported hearing a "monkey-type" chant during a game in Victoria's top soccer league last week.

title.children: Racist chant at soccer match referred to Football Victoria, police

image.altText: Four people sit close together as they pose for a picture.

props.synopsis: A defence lawyer tells jurors they cannot right the wrongs of Victoria's youth, during the trial of a man accused of murdering a Box Hill doctor.Â

title.children: Court hears boys left fatally wounded GP lying lifeless on ground

image.altText: A single prop 8 person aircraft sits inside a hanger.

props.synopsis: Manufacturers of a new aircraft say it will boost jobs in Victoria's Latrobe Valley after a founding family of the airline business buys it back from foreign ownership.

title.children: Family aviation firm promises more jobs after taking back control

image.altText: Picture capturing the science process of IVF

props.synopsis: Australia's health ministers have agreed to undertake a "rapid review" of the nation's fertility sector following a second Monash IVF embryo mix-up.

title.children: Review into IVF accreditation launched after latest Monash embryo mix-up

image.altText: Kangaroo close up

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan says kangaroos are putting pressure on pastures and has taken steps to speed up the control permit process.

title.children: Kangaroo control fast-tracked to help Victorian farmers in drought

image.altText: Farmer Greg Finlay is removing a fence from flood debris.

props.synopsis: Many people are wondering how they can help struggling farmers hit hard this past year by drought and floods. It turns out there are options.

title.children: Fixing fences and buying local â you can help farmers doing it tough

image.altText: Simon Goodwin with his arm around Kysaiah Pickett

props.synopsis: Melbourne coach Simon Goodwin calls Kysaiah Pickett's decision to re-commit to the club a massive endorsement of the club's oft-criticised culture.

title.children: Goodwin says Pickett's $12m extension proof Melbourne's culture 'in good order'

image.altText: A pile of coloured synthetic hay bale twine

props.synopsis: Recycling agricultural bags could divert up to 45,000 tonnes of single-use soft plastics from landfill, burning or burying on-farm each year, making new products instead.

title.children: Farm plastic recycling to deal with thousands of tonnes of waste

image.altText: An elderly woman and man, who is in a wheelchair, in their living room.

props.synopsis: Clients of aged and disability care service Annecto say they have not been told who will be taking its place.

title.children: Sudden closure of major care provider leaves thousands scrambling
